field.name: level of detail
field.definition:
If a model is further away than the LOD reduction distance, it will be reduced to that LOD. So the L1 reduction distance should be really long and the L5 reduction distance should be really short. This means distances should be in descending order, e.g. 5 4 3 2 1.
Note that if we run out of memory or too many models are on screen at once, the engine may reduce models to a lower LOD BEFORE they reach the reduction distance for that LOD.
If a model has a max draw distance, it will disappear when it reaches that distance. The max draw distance should be greater than all of the LOD reduction distances.

definition.entry: fade at super high detail level
fade at super low detail level

field.name: region name
field.units: must match region name in render_model

field.name: looping effect
field.help: played while the model is in this state

field.name: sort order
field.help: negative values mean closer to the camera

definition.entry: parent never takes body damage for us
parent never takes shield damage for us

field.name: global indirect material name
field.help: absorbes AOE or child damage

field.name: body system shock
field.help: anything that kills us (body depleted) doing more than this amount of damage also destroys us

field.name: friendly damage resistance
field.help: the fraction of damage caused by friendly units ignored by this object (zero means full damage)

field.name: body damaged threshold
field.help: when passing this vitality the 'body damaged' effect, below, is created

field.name: body destroyed threshold
field.help: when passing this vitality (usually negative) the object is deleted

field.name: maximum shield vitality
field.help: the default initial and maximum shield vitality of this object

field.name: minimum stun damage
field.help: the minimum damage required to stun this object's shields

field.name: stun time
field.help: the length of time the shields stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage

field.name: recharge time
field.help: the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted

field.name: damage section flags
field.definition: * absorbs body damage: damage to this section does not count against body vitality * headshottable: takes extra headshot damage when shot * ignores shields: damage to this section bypasses shields

definition.entry: takes full dmg when object dies
takes full dmg when obj dstryd

field.name: vitality percentage
field.help: percentage of total object vitality

field.name: Constraint damage type
field.definition: * if you specify a constraint group name (see lower section of this block) you can specify a constraint damage * loosening a constraint takes it out of the rigid state - activates it * destroying a constraint sets the attached body free

field.name: Damage response flags
field.definition: * kills object: when the response fires the object dies regardless of its current health * inhibits <x>: from halo 1 - disallows basic behaviors for a unit * forces drop weapon: from halo 1 - makes the unit drop its current weapon * kills weapon <x> trigger: destroys the <x> trigger on the unit's current weapon * destroys object: when the response fires the object is destroyed

field.name: damage threshold
field.help: repsonse fires after crossing this threshold. 1=full health

field.name: Response delay
field.definition: If desired, you can specify a delay until the response fires.This delay is pre-empted if another timed response for the same section fires.The delay effect plays while the timer is counting down

field.name: response delay
field.help: in seconds

field.name: Constraint destruction
field.definition: - a response can destroy a single constraint by naming it explicitly. - alternatively it can randomly destroy a single constraint from a specified group if the "destroy one group constraint" flag is set - also it can destroy all constraints in a specified group if the "destroy all group constraints" flag is set

field.name: skip fraction
field.definition: 0.0 always fires, 1.0 never fires

field.name: destroyed child object marker name
field.definition: when this response fires, any children objects created at the supplied marker name will be destroyed

field.name: total damage threshold
field.definition: scale on total damage section vitality

definition.entry: parent never takes body damage for us
parent never takes shield damage for us

field.name: global indirect material name
field.help: absorbes AOE or child damage

field.name: indirect damage section
field.help: absorbes AOE or child damage

field.name: minimum stun damage
field.help: the minimum damage required to stun this object's health

field.name: stun time
field.help: the length of time the health stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage

field.name: recharge time
field.help: the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted

field.name: recharge fraction
field.help: 0 defaults to 1 - to what maximum level the body health will be allowed to recharge

field.name: maximum shield vitality
field.help: the default initial and maximum shield vitality of this object

field.name: minimum stun damage
field.help: the minimum damage required to stun this object's shields

field.name: stun time

field.name: vitality percentage
field.help: percentage of total object vitality

field.name: Constraint damage type
field.definition: * if you specify a constraint group name (see lower section of this block) you can specify a constraint damage * loosening a constraint takes it out of the rigid state - activates it * destroying a constraint sets the attached body free

field.name: Damage response flags
field.definition: * kills object: when the response fires the object dies regardless of its current health * inhibits <x>: from halo 1 - disallows basic behaviors for a unit * forces drop weapon: from halo 1 - makes the unit drop its current weapon * kills weapon <x> trigger: destroys the <x> trigger on the unit's current weapon * destroys object: when the response fires the object is destroyed

field.name: damage threshold
field.help: repsonse fires after crossing this threshold. 1=full health

field.name: Response delay
field.definition: If desired, you can specify a delay until the response fires.This delay is pre-empted if another timed response for the same section fires.The delay effect plays while the timer is counting down

field.name: response delay
field.help: in seconds

field.name: Constraint destruction
field.definition: - a response can destroy a single constraint by naming it explicitly. - alternatively it can randomly destroy a single constraint from a specified group if the "destroy one group constraint" flag is set - also it can destroy all constraints in a specified group if the "destroy all group constraints" flag is set

field.name: skip fraction
field.definition: 0.0 always fires, 1.0 never fires

field.name: destroyed child object marker name
field.definition: when this response fires, any children objects created at the supplied marker name will be destroyed

field.name: total damage threshold
field.definition: scale on total damage section vitality

field.name: direct damage scale
field.help: 0==no damage, 1==full damage

field.name: level of detail
field.definition:
If a model is further away than the LOD reduction distance, it will be reduced to that LOD. So the L1 reduction distance should be really long and the L5 reduction distance should be really short. This means distances should be in descending order, e.g. 5 4 3 2 1.
Note that if we run out of memory or too many models are on screen at once, the engine may reduce models to a lower LOD BEFORE they reach the reduction distance for that LOD.
If a model has a begin fade distance and disappear distance, it will begin fading out at that distance, reaching zero alpha and disappearing at the disappear distance. These distances should be greater than all of the LOD reduction distances.

definition.entry: fade at super high detail level
fade at super low detail level

field.name: direct damage scale
field.help: 0==no damage, 1==full damage

field.name: marker name
field.help: multiple markers become multiple spheres of the same radius

field.name: size
field.help: sphere radius

field.name: cone angle
field.help: the target is only visible when viewed within this angle of the marker's x axis

field.name: damage section
field.help: the target is associated with this damage section

field.name: variant
field.help: the target will only appear with this variant

field.name: targeting relevance
field.help: higher relevances turn into stronger magnetisms

field.name: default dialogue
field.help: The default dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)

field.name: default dialogue effect
field.help: The default dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)

field.name: SCENARIO LOAD PARAMETERS
field.definition: strip-variant <variant-name> strips a given variant out of the model tag strip-dialogue strips all the dialogue for this model i.e. cinematic only

field.name: HOLOGRAM
field.definition: hologram shader is applied whenever the control function from it's object is non-zero
